abstract: Companies, in attempt to control costs, are evolving from annual pay raises for employees to one-time bonuses and nonmonetary rewards; impact on workers is drastic since yearly salary increases compound over time.
lead_paragraph: Employees are steadily missing out on annual salary increases that compound over time, as companies exercise financial control by opting for one-off bonuses and other rewards.

headline.main: One-Time Bonuses and Perks Muscle Out Pay Raises for Workers
headline.print_headline: One-Off Perks and Bonuses Supplant Raises
